revisions.rev:
{{Use British English|date=November 2011}} {{Infobox Strictly Come Dancing Series | season_name = Strictly Come Dancing (series 8) | image = | caption = New 2010 Logo | celebrity_winner = [[Kara Tointon]] | professional_winner = [[Artem Chigvintsev]] | country = United Kingdom | network = [[BBC One]] | first_aired = {{nowrap|{{start date|2010|9|11|df=y}} (Launch)}}
{{nowrap|{{start date|2010|10|1|df=y}} (Live Shows)}} | last_aired = {{end date|2010|12|18|df=y}} | num_episodes = 25 | prev_series = [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 7)|Series 7]] | next_series = [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 9)|Series 9 ]] }} The eighth series of ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' began with a [[red carpet]] launch show on 11 September 2010, and the competitive live shows began on 1 October. The series concluded on 18 December when Kara Tointon and Artem Chigvintsev won the competition. According to BARB data, this series was the consistently highest rated of the show to date, peaking at 14.28 million viewers.http://www.barb.co.uk/report/weeklyTopProgrammesOverview There are 14 couples in this series and three new male professionals, [[Artem Chigvintsev]], Robin Windsor and [[Jared Murillo (dancer)|Jared Murillo]]. For series 8 the set has been totally revamped to try and attract more viewers to the programme, the backstage room where scores were given has been replaced by a tower above the dancefloor so the couples can watch as their team mates perform (much like the so-called 'celebriquarium' on the American version ''[[Dancing With The Stars]]''). In week 8 of the competition the live show was transmitted from the [[Blackpool Tower]] Ballroom.{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/strictlycomedancing/news/2010_first_news.shtml |title=Three new guys join the team |publisher=[[BBC Online]] |accessdate=8 September 2010}} This series is presented by [[Bruce Forsyth]] and [[Tess Daly]] on Saturday. On Sunday, for the results show, Daly is joined by ''[[Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two|It Takes Two]]'' presenter Claudia Winkleman. The celebrities did not know their professional partners until they were introduced to each other at the launch show.{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/strictlycomedancing/2010/dancers/ |title=Dancers |publisher=[[BBC Online]] |accessdate=8 September 2010}} ==Couples== {| class="wikitable" style="margin:auto; text-align:center; font-size:100%;" |- ! 46 |style="background:darkgray;" colspan="10"| |} {{Strictly Come Dancing table key}} * '''Week 1''' â Night 1: 7 of the 14 couples performed either a Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha, there was a tie for top of the leader board between Matt & Aliona and Pamela & James both scoring 31/40 in the Cha-Cha-Cha and Waltz respectively. Paul & Ola finished in bottom place with 16/40 * '''Week 1''' â Night 2: The remaining 7 couples performed again a Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha, Kara & Artem finished top of the leader board despite a stumble in their Cha-Cha-Cha with 30/40 and a highly anticipated Ann Widdecombe finished bottom with 17/40. * '''Week 2''': All 14 couples performed either a Foxtrot or a Salsa, all the scores awarded on the evening were added to those from the previous week, top of the leader board were Pamela & James with 63/80 for both nights, at the bottom were Ann & Anton with 29/80. On 10 October 2010, in the first results show, Peter & Erin and Goldie & Kristina found themselves in the bottom two. It was then announced that Goldie was the first eliminee of Strictly Come Dancing 2010. * '''Week 3''': 12 of the 13 remaining couples danced either a Quickstep or a Rumba this week, as Tina O'Brien had caught [[chicken pox]] and did not perform on doctor's orders. Pamela & James once again received the highest score of the night, 35, with three nines awarded to them. Paul & Ola only received 16/40 for their Rumba, placing them at the bottom of the leader board with Ann & Anton, who reached 18. Paul & Ola and Michelle & Brendan found themselves in the bottom two, with Paul & Ola eventually leaving the competition for good. * '''Week 4''': Michelle danced with Ian Waite this week because Brendan had gone back home to be with his family following the death of his father.http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s104/strictly-come-dancing/news/a282565/cole-leaves-strictly-after-fathers-death.html Scott & Natalie and Matt & Aliona took top spot equally for their Tango and Charleston respectively, with 35/40. Peter & Erin only scored 17/40 for their Charleston, and were subsequently eliminated. Michelle & Ian joined them in the bottom two. * '''Week 5''': This week was a [[Halloween]] special, and each couple danced either a Jive, an Argentine Tango, a Viennese Waltz or a Paso Doble. Kara and Artem received the first 10 of the series for their Paso Doble but Scott & Natalie received three 10s and the highest score so far, placing them at the top spot. Ann & Anton placed last on the judges' scoreboard again with 16/40, but Tina & Jared were eliminated, despite being 12 points from the bottom. Felicity & Vincent joined them in the bottom two. * '''Week 6''': Each couple performed a different dance, all performed in previous weeks. Despite receiving their highest score so far, and finishing fourth on the judges' scoreboard, Jimi & Flavia were eliminated. Michelle & Brendan were once again in the Bottom Two, for the third time this series. Kara & Artem received 36/40 for their salsa, placing them at the top spot on the leader board. * '''Week 7''': Kara & Artem received two 10s for their Argentine Tango, but Scott & Natalie received the highest scores of the night with 39/40 for their Jive; an improvement of 11 points from last week's score of 28. Ann & Anton were once again the lowest scoring couple, with 20/40 for their Foxtrot. Michelle & Brendan were second to the bottom with a score of 24/40. After the public vote they and Felicity & Vincent were the bottom two and were then eliminated. * '''Week 8''': This week's show was broadcast live from the [[Blackpool Tower]] ballroom, in which the eight remaining couples performed either an American Smooth or a Samba. Matt & Aliona's Samba came top of the leaderboard with 38 points, the highest score for a Samba since series 3; on the contrary, Ann & Anton were at the bottom of the leaderboard, earning only 13 points for their Samba, the lowest recorded score for a Samba on the show. They were able to evade elimination once more, as Felicity & Vincent went home instead, with Patsy & Robin rounding out the other half of the bottom two. *'''Week 9''': For the fifth time in a row, Ann & Anton took bottom place on the leaderboard with 14 points out of 40 with a [[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]] themed Rumba. Pamela & James went to the top of the leaderboard with 38 for their Charleston. Ann & Anton managed to avoid the bottom two once again; in their place were Patsy & Robin and Gavin & Katya, with Patsy & Robin leaving the competition. *'''Week 10''': Gavin & Katya made an 11-point improvement over last week's Jive with their Foxtrot. Kara & Artem received two 10s for their Tango and Pamela & James received the first perfect forty of the season for their Viennese Waltz, placing them at the top for the second week running. Ann & Anton received 14 points out of 40 and were finally eliminated after placing last on the leaderboard for seven weeks. Scott & Natalie survived the bottom two for the first time. *'''Week 11''': Kara & Artem received their highest scores of the season for their Rumba and Viennese Waltz, both of which received 39 out of 40 and won the Swing Marathon, giving them a top of the leader board finish for the first time since Week 6. Pamela & James received their second perfect 40 of the season for their Quickstep. Gavin & Katya were at the bottom of the judges' leaderboard for the first time this season, and were eliminated along with Scott & Natalie in a double elimination. *'''Week 12''': Despite being top of the leaderboard before the vote freeze, and scoring a perfect score for their first dance, Pamela & James were eliminated from the competition finishing in third place. After the phone-lines reopened, Kara & Artem took over at the top of the leaderboard, and upon the lines closing, were announced as the champions, with Matt & Aliona finishing as runners-up. === Highest and lowest scoring performances of the series === The best and worst performances in each dance according to the judges' marks are as follows: {| class="wikitable sortable" ! due to illness *Week 1 â Waltz or Cha-Cha-Cha *Week 2 â Foxtrot or Salsa *Week 3 â Quickstep or Rumba *Week 4 â Tango or Charleston *Week 5 â Viennese Waltz, Jive, Paso Doble or Argentine Tango (Halloween-themed week) *Week 6 & 7 â One unlearned dance from weeks 1â5 *Week 8 â American Smooth or Samba (Blackpool Special) *Week 9 â One unlearned dance from weeks 1â8 *Week 10 â One unlearned dance from weeks 1â8 (Movie-themed quarter-final) *Week 11 (Night 1) â First unlearned dance from weeks 1â8 & Swing Marathon (Semi-final) *Week 11 (Night 2) â Second unlearned dance from weeks 1â8 (Semi-final) *Week 12 â The Final: One unlearned dance from weeks 1â8, highest scoring dance of the series, favourite dance of the series, & Showdance ==TV Ratings== Weekly ratings for each show on [[BBC1]]. Figures exclude the BBC HD Channel. only ==Professional partners== Each year the professional dancers perform professional routines and dance to the special guest. With three new male professional dancers some of the professional pairings have changed again. The following professional partners will dance with each other for the professional routines: *Anton du Beke & Erin Boag *Brendan Cole & Natalie Lowe *James Jordan & Ola Jordan *Vincent Simone & Flavia Cacace *Artem Chigvintsev & Katya Virshilas *Jared Murillo & Aliona Vilani *Robin Windsor & Kristina Rihanoff === Professional Dance Troupe === *Darren Bennett & Crystal Main *Ian Waite & Aneta Piotrowska *Shem Jacobs & Tanya Perera{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/strictlycomedancing/2010/dancers/showdancers/|title=The Strictly Showdancers|publisher=BBC |accessdate=16 November 2010}} The dances that the Dance Troupe have performed: * '''Launch Show''': Quickstep and Jive to "[[Ballroom Blitz]]" by [[Sweet (band)|The Sweet]]. * '''Week 2''': Quickstep to "[[Hey, Soul Sister]]" by [[Train (band)|Train]]. * '''Week 5''': Viennese Waltz to "[[Never Tear Us Apart]]" by [[INXS]]. * '''Week 6''': Rock 'n' Roll to "Rock 'n' Roll Is Here to Stay" by [[Danny and the Juniors]], "[[Roll Over Beethoven]]" by [[Chuck Berry]], "[[Shake, Rattle And Roll]]" by [[Bill Haley]]. * '''Week 7''': Paso Doble to "[[The Entertainer (Alesha Dixon album)|Radio]]" by [[Alesha Dixon]] (in front of live artist). * '''Week 10''': [[ABBA]] Medley to "[[Mamma Mia (song)|Mamma Mia]]", "[[Lay All Your Love on Me]]", "[[Take a Chance on Me]]". * '''Week 11''': Paso Doble to "[[Fire With Fire (song)|Fire With Fire]]" by [[Scissor Sisters]]. ==Celebrity performances== Each week various celebrities perform on the results show, often accompanied by some of the professional couples. *Week 1: [[Robbie Williams]] & [[Gary Barlow]] â "[[Shame (Robbie Williams song)|Shame]]" *Week 2: [[Robbie Williams]] â "[[Rock DJ (song)|Rock DJ]]" *Week 3: [[Peter Andre]] â "[[Defender (Peter Andre song)|Defender]]" *Week 4: [[Neil Diamond]] â "[[Midnight Train to Georgia]]" *Week 5: [[Alice Cooper]] â "[[Poison (Alice Cooper song)|Poison]]" ([[Halloween]] special) *Week 6: [[Bryan Ferry]] â "[[You Can Dance]]" *Week 7: [[Annie Lennox]] â "[[A Christmas Cornucopia|Universal Child]]" & [[Alesha Dixon]] â "[[The Entertainer (Alesha Dixon album)|Radio]]" *Week 8: [[Duffy (singer)|Duffy]] â "[[Well, Well, Well (Duffy song)|Well, Well, Well]]" *Week 9: [[James Blunt]] â "So Far Gone" *Week 10: [[Manic Street Preachers]] â "[[Some Kind of Nothingness]]" *Week 11: [[Take That]] â "[[The Flood (Take That song)|The Flood]]" & "[[Back for Good]]" *Week 12: [[Paloma Faith]] â "[[Upside Down (Paloma Faith song)|Upside Down]]" ==References==
